content.question: Mumford overlooks which of the following broader historical contexts that best explains why many Americans might have been attracted to the consistency and conformity of the suburbs?

choices.label: The rise of youth rebellion against middle class values helped expand a new consumer niche for products marketed directly to teenagers.
Many Americans developed a more cosmopolitan outlook after experiencing cultures different from their own during the Second World War.
Recent periods of economic depression and war encouraged many families to seek stability and security.
The technological innovations available in new homes, such as air-conditioning and dishwashers, fostered a sense of social isolation for many women.

content.answer: Recent periods of economic depression and war encouraged many families to seek stability and security.
